On Apr 19, 2007, at 10:34 AM, Stephen Waits wrote:

> shanemcdonaldryan wrote:
> >
> > How would I get GCC to auto-vectorize it?
>
> I'll take a stab at it when I get home tonight.

Bah.. Couldn't get gcc to do it.  Oh well.  It's so little data, it  
might have actually been slower anyway.  SIMD is all about streaming  
lots of data.  For one (or two) vectors of data, it's usually not  
worth it.  Now, if you were going to queue up a large number of  
evaluations, then you could see massive gains (potentially 2x to 4x).

Now, one thing I did do was plot your polynomial.  Have you done  
that?  You might want to take a look at it.  The way I see it, it's  
nearly linear for x=[-1,1], and looks nothing like a sigmoidal function!

--Steve
--Apple-Mail-27--982004469
